result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Possession with Intent to Deliver Methamphetamine

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chong N. Moua

records.addlTxt:
10:02 AM case called. Defendant Chong N. Moua not in court, in custody.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Chong N. Moua.  Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Hearing scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:42 AM case called. Defendant Chong N. Moua not in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard appeared by video for Chong N. Moua.  Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
State requests a warrant- so ordered.

Conditions: 
No contact with co-defendant C.V.
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.

(11:07 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Chong N. Moua appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Sonia L Anderson appeared by video for Chong N. Moua.
Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint and waives time limits for preliminary hearing.
Defendant is eligible for Public Defender representation.
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on August 24, 2022 at 1:45 pm.
Hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions: 
No contact with co-defendant C.V.
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.
